data.name: Multiplying Binomials
data.description:
As you likely learned in school, you can square a binomial such as (2x - 5) to get an expression like 4x^2 - 20x + 25. While such an operation is easy for a human to do (see http://bit.ly/2n5O8xq if you have not seen these types of problems before), it is much more complicated to multiply binomials by themselves hundreds of times.

You will have to write a program that will parse a binomial given to you as a string in the form of "(ax + b)", multiply the binomial by itself a given number of times, and return a string containing each term and its coefficient sorted by the value of the exponent to which x is raised.

For example, if your program recieved "(2x - 5)" and the power 3, it should return "8x^3 - 60x^2 + 150x - 125".

Notes:

Spaces will always be included in the binomial you are given. For example, you would never be given "2x-5", instead, you will be given "2x - 5".

Do not include a term if its coefficient is zero. For example, your program should never return "3x^2 + 0x - 5", it should instead return "3x^2 - 5". 

Do not include a coefficient if the coefficient is one. For example, your program should never return "1x + 5", it should instead return "x + 5". Additionally, your program should never return "-1x + 5", it should instead return "-x + 5".

Spacing may be included in the returned string, but is not required. For example, "3x-5" is just as valid as "3x - 5".

Your program should work for all integer, non-negative powers (including zero). Note that anything to the zeroth power is always one.
